judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA AT CHANDIGARH Criminal Revision No. 179 of 1998 Date of decision : 22.9.2008 Mange Ram ....Petitioner Versus

State of Haryana and others ...Respondents **** CORAM : HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE S. D. ANAND Present: Mr. Rajinder Goyal, Advocate for the petitioner. Mr. S.S.Mor, Senior Deputy Adocate General, Haryana for the respondent-State. Mr. H.S.Gill, Senior Advocate with Mr. R.K.Dhiman, Advocate for the respondents S. D. ANAND, J. In view of the fact that the parties to the impugned prosecution have been allowed to compound the offence vide order of even date passed by this Court in Criminal Appeal No. 1018-SB of 1998 (Shera and others Vs. State of Haryana). Thus, plea preferred by the complainant to challenge the acquittal of some of the accused is rendered infructuous. Disposed of accordingly. September 22, 2008 (S. D. ANAND) Pka

JUDGE
reasoning: Rule matches: {'dismissed': ['disposed of', 'disposed of', 'disposed of']}; selected 'dismissed' with score 3.46.
